pages.title: Script Types Overview
pages.purpose: Overview of different script_type categories and their purposes

page_notes.content: Overview of different script_type categories and their purposes. Add a section for the 'Scripts/Custom' directory that is created when opening the Move Editor if it doesn't exist. The Custom directory mirrors the Common directory's structure, allowing the end user to add script entries that won't be lost due to an offical update to the JSON in the Common directory. The custom directory is checked first when evaluating state ids and are prioritized over the common directory if found.

pages.title: General System Commands (Type 03)
pages.purpose: Document script_type 03 commands for animations, movement, combat mechanics, visual/audio effects, and camera control.

page_notes.content: Type 25/03 commands are system-level commands, calling internal game functions to change game behavior. These commands can be set to execute exclusively on a specifed frame by prefixing a frame number before the state id and calling them with type 19 instead of 03. Ex: [frame][state_id][args...]

pages.title: State Commands (Type 25/0d)
pages.purpose: Document script_type 0d commands for special states, Soul Charge mechanics, meter management, and attack properties

page_notes.content: For Type 25/0d commands the state id refers to another move id in the movelist, allowing editing of the command's script logic.

pages.title: Condition Checks (Type A5/01 and Type A5/0d)
pages.purpose: Document condition check scripts for button inputs, character states, opponent properties, and game state queries

page_notes.content: Type A5/01 is used for either system-level checks or fetching particular values such as current frame and active start/end frame from the hitbox data. Type A5/0d gets a return value specified in a move script (refer to Type 25/0d)
